FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE C SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION PART IV
ExplntnTxt: The National Alliance for Public Charter Schools is the leading organization committed to advancing quality, growth and sustainability for the movement. We speak and advocate for the hundreds of thousands of other students who are hoping for the chance to attend a charter school. We work at the federal, state and national level to accomplish this purpose. We provide assistance to state charter school associations and resource centers, develop and advocate for improved public policies, and serve as the united voice for this large and diverse movement. We focus on key priorities like replicating and expanding high-quality charter schools, lifting arbitrary "caps" on charter growth and closing the funding gap between charters and other public schools. NAPCS policy experts work directly with federal and state-level organizations to encourage these charter-friendly policies and ultimately ensure charter schools are treated equitably with traditional district public schools under the law.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part II-B, Line 1i - Other Activities Description
ExplntnTxt: AGS advocates and informs congress/legislators on the field of geriatrics and the importance of the health care of older adults. It informs its members of legislative alerts and updates by making available information on its website and throught e-mail alerts about important issues related to geriatrics and the healthcare of older adults. AGS also reviews curreng legislation as it related to geriatrics and the care of older adults by offering summaries and status information about key bills related to the field of geriatrics. AGS informs its membres as to how the individual congressmen and congresswomen may vote and has voted on such bills. Finally, AGS informs its members of how best to communicate with congressional staffers and help their membesr understand the legislative process.

Texas Watch Foundation conducts public outreach and education programs on consumer protection, insurance, product safety and family safety issues. Texas Watch Foundation releases reports on the state of consumer protection system and the effect of legislative and regulatory actions on the Texas consumer protection system and provides consumer protection and education materials to the public.
ORGANIZATION'S DIRECT AND INDIRECT POLITICAL CAMPAIGN ACTIVITIES NONE

CORRECTION MADE: The Foundation reimburses expenses individuals incur to attend the Foundations educational legislative summits. Instead of reimbursing two individuals for the expenses they incurred in attending a legislative summit, the reimbursements were inadvertently issued to the individuals political campaigns. When the Foundation discovered the reimbursements were issued to political campaigns rather than the state legislators in their individual capacity, the Foundation promptly requested that the funds be returned and issued replacement checks to the individual legislators once all the funds had been recovered by the Foundation. The Foundation has filed Form 4720 and has requested full abatement of all taxes, penalties and interest under Section 4962 of the Internal Revenue Code. Accordingly, the Foundation has reported no taxes incurred on Schedule C, Part I-B, Line 1.

LOBBYING EXPENDITURES TO INFLUENCE PUBLIC OPINION: THE FRIEDMAN FOUNDATION FOR EDUCATIONAL CHOICE IS NEVER INVOLVED IN POLITICAL CAMPAIGNS. THE SUBSTANTIAL ACTIVITY UNDERTAKEN BY THE FRIEDMAN FOUNDATION FOR EDUCATIONAL CHOICE IS EDUCATIONAL IN NATURE. THE FOUNDATION HAS MADE AN ELECTION UNDER SECTION 501(H) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. CONSISTENT WITH AN ORGANIZATION EXEMPT UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) WITH "H ELECTION," THE FOUNDATION ALSO UNDERTAKES LIMITED LOBBYING ACTIVITIES IN CERTAIN STATES TO AID IN THE PASSAGE OF LEGISLATION THAT ENABLES PARENTS TO RECEIVE A PUBLICLY FUNDED VOUCHER OR A TAX CREDIT FUNDED SCHOLARSHIP TO SEND THEIR CHILDREN TO APPROVED PRIVATE SCHOOLS. IN 2015, THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDED ALLOCATING STAFF TIME FOR DIRECT LOBBYING TO STATE LEGISLATORS AND ENCOURAGING THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO SUPPORT SPECIFIC LEGISLATION.

THE STATE WIDE AGENCY (BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS ALBUQUERQUE) ENGAGED A LOBBYIST TO ADVOCATE FOR THE BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS ORGANIZATIONS. THE ORGANIZATION REIMBURSED THE BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS ALBUQUERQUE MONTHLY FOR THE LOBBYING SERVICES.

THE JOHN D. THOMPSON HOSPICE INSTITUTE FOR EDUCATION, TRAINING AND RESEARCH'S MISSION IS TO EDUCATE AND TRAIN CAREGIVERS AND CONDUCT RESEARCH. THIS REQUIRES THE ONGOING DEVELOPMENT OF REGULATIONS THAT WOULD SUPPORT THIS EFFORT. IN PARTICULAR, WITH THE RELOCATION OF THE INSTITUTE, ALTHOUGH WITHIN THE SAME PROVINCE, IT IS IMPORTANT TO MAINTAIN THESE STANDARDS.

THE SCHOLARS STRATEGY NETWORK PROVIDED RESEARCH TO INFORM POLICY REFORMS ON ISSUES INCLUDING HEALTH CARE, CRIMINAL JUSTICE, HOUSING, EDUCATION, TRADE, CLIMATE CHANGE, IMMIGRATION, VOTING RIGHTS, CIVIL RIGHTS AND ECONOMIC POLICY.
